wikipedia_page.main: Colin Chad Lyman (9 March 1914 – 9 May 1986) was an English footballer who played as a forward. He scored 54 goals in 188 league games in the Football League playing for West Bromwich Albion, Southend United, Northampton Town, Tottenham Hotspur, Port Vale, Nottingham Forest, and Notts County. He went on to serve Nuneaton Borough as player-manager from August 1948 to December 1950.
